Cantrips. You know two cantrips of your choice from the Bard spell list. @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplViciousMoc]{Vicious Mockery} are recommended.

Whenever you gain a Bard level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Bard spell list.

When you reach Bard levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the Bard spell list, as shown in the Cantrips column of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbBard000000000.JournalEntryPage.V8pqIWlaL9GhY61t#class-features]{Bard Features} table.

Spell Slots. The Bard Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

Prepared Spells of Level 1+. You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the Bard spell list. @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCharmPerso]{Charm Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplColorSpray]{Color Spray}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDissonantW]{Dissonant Whispers}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Bard levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Bard Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Bard spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Bard, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Bard feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Bard spells for you.

Changing Your Prepared Spells. Whenever you gain a Bard level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Bard spell for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Bard spells.

Spellcasting Focus. You can use a Musical Instrument as a Spellcasting Focus for your Bard spells.

Stalker's Flurry.name: Ráfaga del Acechador
Stalker's Flurry.description:
The Psychic damage of your Dreadful Strike becomes 2d8. In addition, when you use the Dreadful Strike effect of your Dread Ambusher feature, you can cause one of the following additional effects.

Sudden Strike. You can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and that is within the weapon’s range.

Mass Fear. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature has the &Reference[Frightened] condition until the start of your next turn.

Foundry Note

The damage of your Dreadful Strike activity will automatically scale as you level up.

To use the Sudden Strike effect simply make another attack.

The Mass Fear activity on this feature includes the save.

Mass Fear.name: Mass Fear
Mass Fear.condition: When you use the Dreadful Strike effect

Star Map.name: Mapa Estelar
Star Map.description:
You've created a star chart as part of your heavenly studies. It is a Tiny object, and you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your Druid spells. You determine its form by rolling on the Star Map table or by choosing one.

While holding the map, you have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidance00]{Guidance} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt} spells prepared, and you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt} without expending a spell slot. You can cast it in that way a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

If you lose the map, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to magically create a replacement. This ceremony can be performed during a Short or Long Rest, and it destroys the previous map.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.tables.RollTable.phbStarMapForms0 rollable]

Foundry Note

The spells are granted to you automatically and Guiding Bolt includes the limited uses. They are not automatically removed if you do not have a Star Map however.

Starry Form.name: Forma Estelar
Starry Form.description:
As a Bonus Action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to take on a starry form rather than shape-shifting.

While in your starry form, you retain your game statistics, but your body becomes luminous, your joints glimmer like stars, and glowing lines connect them as on a star chart. This form sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet. The form lasts for 10 minutes. It ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), have the Incapacitated condition, or use this feature again.

Whenever you assume your starry form, choose which of the following constellations glimmers on your body; your choice gives you certain benefits while in the form.

Archer. A constellation of an archer appears on you. When you activate this form and as a Bonus Action on your subsequent turns while it lasts, you can make a ranged spell attack, hurling a luminous arrow that targets one creature within 60 feet of yourself. On a hit, the attack deals Radiant damage equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier.

Chalice. A constellation of a life-giving goblet appears on you. Whenever you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores Hit Points to a creature, you or another creature within 30 feet of you can regain Hit Points equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier.

Dragon. A constellation of a wise dragon appears on you. When you make an Intelligence or a Wisdom check or a Constitution saving throw to maintain Concentration, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

Foundry Note

The Consume Wild Shape activity will consume your use of Wild Shape and provide an Active Effect for tracking your Starry Form. It also includes activities for the Archer, Chalice, and Dragon form.

This feature does not automate the light changes.

Chalice.name: Chalice
Chalice.condition: Whenever you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores Hit Points

Dragon Form.name: Dragon Form
Dragon Form.description: A constellation of a wise dragon appears on you. When you make an Intelligence or a Wisdom check or a Constitution saving throw to maintain Concentration, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

Steady Aim.name: Puntería Firme
Steady Aim.description: As a Bonus Action, you give yourself Advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this feature only if you haven’t moved during this turn, and after you use it, your Speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

Steps of the Fey.name: Pasos de las Hadas
Steps of the Fey.description:
Your patron grants you the ability to move between the boundaries of the planes. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step} without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

In addition, whenever you cast that spell, you can choose one of the following additional effects.

Refreshing Step. Immediately after you teleport, you or one creature you can see within 10 feet of yourself gains 1d10 Temporary Hit Points.

Taunting Step. Creatures within 5 feet of the space you left must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have Disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

Foundry Note

The Refreshing Step activity includes the Temporary Hit Points.

The Taunting Step activity includes the save and an Active Effect for tracking but it does not automate the effect.

You are granted the spell with free uses as you level up.

Taunted.name: Taunted
Taunted.description: This creature has Disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

Stormborn.name: Nacido de la Tormenta
Stormborn.description:
Your Wrath of the Sea confers two more benefits while active, as detailed below.

Flight. You gain a Fly Speed equal to your Speed.

Resistance. You have Resistance to Cold, Lightning, and Thunder damage.

Foundry Note

You can use this feature in place of Wrath of the Sea. It includes an Active Effect which will automate the addition of the Resistances. It does not add the Fly Speed though.

Stride of the Elements.name: Paso de los Elementos
Stride of the Elements.description:
While your Elemental Attunement is active, you also have a Fly Speed and a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

Foundry Note

This feature does not automatically grant the Fly and Swim Speed.

Stroke of Luck.name: Golpe de Suerte
Stroke of Luck.description:
You have a marvelous knack for succeeding when you need to. If you fail a D20 Test, you can turn the roll into a 20.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

Stroke of Luck.name: Stroke of Luck
Stroke of Luck.condition: When you fail a D20 Test

Student of War.name: Estudiante de Guerra
Student of War.description:
You gain proficiency with one type of Artisan's Tools of your choice, and you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice from the skills available to Fighters at level 1.

Foundry Note

You will be prompted for these choices while leveling up.

Studied Attacks.name: Ataques Estudiados
Studied Attacks.description:
You study your opponents and learn from each attack you make. If you make an attack roll against a creature and miss, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

Foundry Note

This feature does not automate the Advantage on your next attack roll.

Stunning Strike.name: Golpe Aturdidor
Stunning Strike.description:
Once per turn when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend 1 Focus Point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the Stunned condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's Speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and the next attack roll made against the target before then has Advantage.

Foundry Note

This feature includes the Saving Throw and a Stunned Active Effect which applies the Stunned status if they fail and a Slowed Active Effect for tracking that their Speed is halved and that the next attack roll made against them has Advantage if they succeed.

save.condition: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon or an Unarmed Strike

Subtle Spell.name: Conjuro Sutil
Subtle Spell.description:
Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast it without any Verbal, Somatic, or Material components, except Material components that are consumed by the spell or that have a cost specified in the spell.

Superior Critical.name: Crítico Superior
Superior Critical.description:
Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can now score a Critical Hit on a roll of 18–20 on the d20.

Foundry Note

This feature automatically increases the Critical Hit threshold to 18.

Superior Defense.name: Defensa Superior
Superior Defense.description:
At the start of your turn, you can expend 3 Focus Points to bolster yourself against harm for 1 minute or until you have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have Resistance to all damage except Force damage.

Foundry Note

This feature will expend 3 Focus Points and includes an Active Effect which will apply the relevant Resistances.

utility.condition: At the start of your turn

Superior Hunter's Defense.name: Defensa del Cazador Superior
Superior Hunter's Defense.description:
When you take damage, you can take a Reaction to give yourself Resistance to that damage and any other damage of the same type until the end of the current turn.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect for resisting each type of damage which can be applied to get the relevant resistance. Be sure you disable/delete the previous Active Effect in the "Effects" tab of your sheet when you change Resistances.

Superior Hunter's Prey.name: Presa del Cazador Superior
Superior Hunter's Prey.description:
Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature marked by your Hunter’s Mark, you can also deal that spell’s extra damage to a different creature that you can see within 30 feet of the first creature.

Foundry Note

You can apply the damage from Hunter's Mark or use the Damage activity on this feature.

Superior Inspiration.name: Inspiración Superior
Superior Inspiration.description: When you roll Initiative, you regain expended uses of Bardic Inspiration until you have two if you have fewer than that.

Supreme Healing.name: Curación Suprema
Supreme Healing.description:
When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore Hit Points to a creature with a spell or Channel Divinity, don't roll those dice for the healing; instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring 2d6 Hit Points to a creature with a spell, you restore 12.

Foundry Note

This feature does not automate the maximizing of all of your rolls.

Supreme Sneak.name: Sigilo Supremo
Supreme Sneak.description:
You gain the following Cunning Strike option.

Stealth Attack (Cost: 1d6). If you have the &Reference[Hide] action’s Invisible condition, this attack doesn’t end that condition on you if you end the turn behind &Reference[Three-Quarters Cover] or &Reference[Total Cover].

Survivor.name: Superviviente
Survivor.description:
You attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle, giving you these benefits.

Defy Death. You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws. Moreover, when you roll 18–20 on a Death Saving Throw, you gain the benefit of rolling a 20 on it.

Heroic Rally. At the start of each of your turns, you regain Hit Points equal to 5 plus your Constitution modifier if you are Bloodied and have at least 1 Hit Point.

Foundry Note

This feature does not automate the Death Saving Throw changes to rolling an 18 or 19, but does include Advantage automation. It includes an activity for healing but does not automatically add it when you are Bloodied.

Defy Death.name: Defy Death
Defy Death.description: Note: This effect does not modify the behavior of rolling an 18 or 19 on a Death Saving Throw.

Sweeping Attack.name: Ataque Arrollador
Sweeping Attack.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to damage another creature. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your Superiority Die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

Foundry Note

The Damage activity allows you to select the type of damage it should deal in the roll dialog and consumes a use of your Superiority Die.

Tactical Assessment.name: Evaluación Táctica
Tactical Assessment.description: When you make an Intelligence (History or Investigation) check or a Wisdom (Insight) check, you can expend one Superiority Die and add that die to the ability check.

utility.condition: When you make an Intelligence (History or Investigation) check or a Wisdom (Insight) check

Tactical Master.name: Maestro Táctico
Tactical Master.description: When you attack with a weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the Push, Sap, or Slow property for that attack.

Tactical Mind.name: Mente Táctica
Tactical Mind.description: You have a mind for tactics on and off the battlefield. When you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of your Second Wind to push yourself toward success. Rather than regaining Hit Points, you roll 1d10 and add the number rolled to the ability check, potentially turning it into a success. If the check still fails, this use of Second Wind isn't expended.

Expend Second Wind.name: Expend Second Wind
Expend Second Wind.condition: When you fail an ability check

Tactical Shift.name: Cambio Táctico
Tactical Shift.description: Whenever you activate your Second Wind with a Bonus Action, you can move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Tamed Surge.name: Oleada Domada
Tamed Surge.description:
Immediately after you cast a Sorcerer spell with a spell slot, you can create an effect of your choice from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.tables.RollTable.phbWildMagicSurg]{Wild Magic Surge} table instead of rolling on that table. You can choose any effect in the table except for the final row, and if the chosen effect involves a roll, you must make it.

Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

Tandem Footwork.name: Juego de Pies en Tándem
Tandem Footwork.description:
When you roll Initiative, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration if you don't have the &Reference[Incapacitated] condition. When you do so, roll your Bardic Inspiration die; you and each ally within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you gains a bonus to Initiative equal to the number rolled.

Foundry Note

Using this feature will consume a usage of your Bardic Inspiration.

Initiative Bonus.name: Initiative Bonus
Initiative Bonus.condition: When rolling initiative and not Incapacitated.

Telekinetic Adept.name: Adepto Telequinético
Telekinetic Adept.description:
You have mastered new ways to use your telekinetic abilities, detailed below.

Psi-Powered Leap. As a Bonus Action, you gain a Fly Speed equal to twice your Speed until the end of the current turn. Once you take this Bonus Action, you can't do so again until you finish a Short or Long Rest unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

Telekinetic Thrust. When you deal damage to a target with your Psionic Strike, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, you can give the target the Prone condition or transport it up to 10 feet horizontally.

Foundry Note

The Psi-Powered Leap activity includes a free use and you can use the Psi-Powered Leap Using Psionic Energy activity to use it again with a Psionic Energy Die. It does not automate the addition of the Fly Speed.

The Telekinetic Thrust activity includes an Active Effect which will can apply the Prone condition.

Telekinetic Thrust.name: Telekinetic Thrust
Telekinetic Thrust.condition: When you deal damage to a target with your Psionic Strike

Telekinetic Master.name: Maestro Telequinético
Telekinetic Master.description:
You always have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTelekinesi]{Telekinesis} spell prepared. With this feature, you can cast it without a spell slot or components, and your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence. On each of your turns while you maintain Concentration on it, including the turn when you cast it, you can make one attack with a weapon as a Bonus Action.

Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

Foundry Note

You are automatically granted the Telekinesis spell as you level up. It includes a free use and configures it to use Intelligence as your spellcasting modifier. You can manually consume a use of your Psionic Energy Die and give yourself another use of the spell.

Telepathic Speech.name: Habla Telepática
Telepathic Speech.description:
You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a Bonus Action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You and the chosen creature can communicate telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 mile, currently: [[lookup @abilities.cha.mod]]). To understand each other, you each must mentally use a language the other knows.

The telepathic connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Sorcerer level. It ends early if you use this ability to form a connection with a different creature.

The Third Eye.name: El Tercer Ojo
The Third Eye.description:
You can increase your powers of perception. As a Bonus Action, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you start a Short or Long Rest. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

Darkvision. You gain Darkvision with a range of 120 feet.

Greater Comprehension. You can read any language.

See Invisibility. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSeeInvisib]{See Invisibility} without expending a spell slot.

Foundry Note

The Darkvision activity includes an Active Effect which grants you Darkvision.

The Greater Comprehension activity includes an Active Effect for tracking.

The See Invisibility activity includes a limited use and an Active Effect for tracking.

Third Eye: Darkvision.name: Third Eye: Darkvision
Third Eye: Darkvision.description: The Third Eye feature grants you Darkvision with a range of 120 feet.

Third Eye: Greater Comprehension.name: Third Eye: Greater Comprehension
Third Eye: Greater Comprehension.description: The Third Eye feature grants you the ability to read any language.

Thief.name: Ladrón
Thief.description:
Hunt for Treasure as a Classic Adventurer

A mix of burglar, treasure hunter, and explorer, you are the epitome of an adventurer. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you gain abilities useful for delving into ruins and getting maximum benefit from the magic items you find there.

Thief's Reflexes.name: Reflejos del Ladrón
Thief's Reflexes.description: You are adept at laying ambushes and quickly escaping danger. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal Initiative and your second turn at your Initiative minus 10.

Thieves' Cant.name: Jerga de Ladrones
Thieves' Cant.description:
You picked up various languages in the communities where you plied your roguish talents. You know Thieves’ Cant and one other language of your choice, which you choose from the language tables in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.t1WP9VEevo4TOTXw#choose-languages]{chapter 2}.

Foundry Note

Thieves' Cant will be added to your sheet automatically and you will be prompted to choose the additional language.

Thirsting Blade.name: Hoja Sedienta
Thirsting Blade.description:
Prerequisite: Level 5+ Warlock, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.classes.Item.phbinvPactBlade0]{Pact of the Blade} Invocation.

You gain the Extra Attack feature for your pact weapon only. With that feature, you can attack twice with the weapon instead of once when you take the Attack action on your turn.

Thought Shield.name: Escudo de Pensamientos
Thought Shield.description: Your thoughts can’t be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. You also have Resistance to Psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals Psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you take.

Thought Shield.name: Thought Shield
Thought Shield.description: Your thoughts can’t be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. You also have Resistance to Psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals Psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you take.

Three Extra Attacks.name: Tres Ataques Adicionales
Three Extra Attacks.description: You can attack four times instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Tides of Chaos.name: Mareas del Caos
Tides of Chaos.description:
You can manipulate chaos itself to give yourself Advantage on one D20 Test before you roll the d20. Once you do so, you must cast a Sorcerer spell with a spell slot or finish a Long Rest before you can use this feature again.

If you do cast a Sorcerer spell with a spell slot before you finish a Long Rest, you automatically roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.tables.RollTable.phbWildMagicSurg]{Wild Magic Surge} table.

Tireless.name: Incansable
Tireless.description:
Primal forces now help fuel you on your journeys, granting you the following benefits.

Temporary Hit Points. As a Magic action, you can give yourself a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Decrease Exhaustion. Whenever you finish a Short Rest, your Exhaustion level, if any, decreases by 1.

Foundry Note

The Temporary Hit Points activity can apply the Temporary Hit Points to you.

The Decrease Exhaustion activity will decrease your Exhaustion.

Decrease Exhaustion.name: Decrease Exhaustion
Decrease Exhaustion.condition: Whenever you finish a Short Rest

Trance of Order.name: Trance del Orden
Trance of Order.description:
You gain the ability to align your consciousness with the endless calculations of Mechanus. As a Bonus Action, you can enter this state for 1 minute. For the duration, attack rolls against you can’t benefit from Advantage, and whenever you make a D20 Test, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points (no action required) to restore your use of it.

Foundry Note

The Enter Trance (Free) activity includes a free use.

The Enter Trance (Sorcery Points) activity will expend five Sorcery Points.

The minimum roll is not automated.

Trance of Order.name: Trance of Order
Trance of Order.description: For the duration, attack rolls against you can’t benefit from Advantage, and whenever you make a D20 Test, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

Transmuted Spell.name: Conjuro Transmutado
Transmuted Spell.description:
Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Thunder.

Transmuted Spell.name: Transmuted Spell
Transmuted Spell.condition: When you cast a spell that deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage

Travel Along the Tree.name: Viajar por el Árbol
Travel Along the Tree.description:
When you activate your Rage and as a Bonus Action while your Rage is active, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

In addition, once per Rage, you can increase the range of that teleport to 150 feet. When you do so, you can also bring up to six willing creatures who are within 10 feet of you. Each creature teleports to an unoccupied space of your choice within 10 feet of your destination space.

Trickery Domain.name: Dominio del Engaño
Trickery Domain.description:
Prospera en el engaño y la ilusión

Los dioses del engaño son protectores de los tramposos y pícaros. Sus clérigos son una fuerza disruptiva en el mundo, usando trucos y mentiras para alcanzar sus objetivos.

Trickery Domain Spells.name: Conjuros del Dominio del Engaño
Trickery Domain Spells.description:
Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Trickery Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

Trickery Domain Spells
Cleric LevelPrepared Spells
3@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCharmPerso]{Charm Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPasswithou]{Pass without Trace}
5@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHypnoticPa]{Hypnotic Pattern}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplNondetecti]{Nondetection}
7@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplConfusion0]{Confusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDimensionD]{Dimension Door}
9@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplModifyMemo]{Modify Memory}

Foundry Note

These spells are granted automatically as you advance.

Trickster's Transposition.name: Transposición del Tramposo
Trickster's Transposition.description:
Whenever you take the Bonus Action to create or move the illusion of your Invoke Duplicity, you can teleport, swapping places with the illusion.

Foundry Note

This feature includes a Transpose activity for tracking the use of your Bonus Action but you will have to manually swap your Token and the Duplicate's position.

Trip Attack.name: Ataque con Zancadilla
Trip Attack.description:
When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend one Superiority Die and add the die to the attack's damage roll. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[Prone] condition.

Foundry Note

This feature will automatically use the higher of your Strength/Dexterity for the save.

The Damage included in the save allows you to select the type of damage it should deal in the roll dialog. It will remember your choice going forwards.

save.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack roll

Twinkling Constellations.name: Constelaciones Centelleantes
Twinkling Constellations.description:
The constellations of your Starry Form improve. The 1d8 of the Archer and the Chalice becomes 2d8, and while the Dragon is active, you have a Fly Speed of 20 feet and can hover.

Moreover, at the start of each of your turns while in your Starry Form, you can change which constellation glimmers on your body.

Foundry Note

The dice increase is handled automatically. This feature does not automatically add the Fly Speed.

Twinned Spell.name: Conjuro Gemelo
Twinned Spell.description:
Cost: 1 Sorcery Point

When you cast a spell, such as Charm Person, that can be cast with a higher-level spell slot to target an additional creature, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to increase the spell’s effective level by 1.

Twinned Spell.name: Twinned Spell
Twinned Spell.condition: When you cast a spell that can be upcast to target an additional creature

Two Extra Attacks.name: Dos Ataques Adicionales
Two Extra Attacks.description: You can attack three times instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Umbral Sight.name: Vista Umbral
Umbral Sight.description:
You gain Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on Darkvision. While entirely in Darkness, you have the &Reference[Invisible] condition to any creature that relies on Darkvision to see you in that Darkness.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which will automatically increase your Darkvision range.

Unarmored Defense.name: Defensa sin Armadura
Unarmored Defense.description: While you aren’t wearing any armor, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Constitution modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

Unarmored Movement.name: Movimiento sin Armadura
Unarmored Movement.description:
Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing armor or wielding a Shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain Monk levels, as shown on the Monk Features table.

Current Increase: [[lookup @scale.monk.unarmored-movement]]

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Unarmored Movement Active Effect which adds 10 feet to your Movement. It can not automatically update as you level up though. You can edit the value to match your current increase.

Unbreakable Majesty.name: Majestad Inquebrantable
Unbreakable Majesty.description:
As a Bonus Action, you can assume a magically majestic presence for 1 minute or until you have the &Reference[Incapacitated] condition. For the duration, whenever any creature hits you with an attack roll for the first time on a turn, the attacker must succeed on a [[/save]]{Charisma saving throw} against your spell save DC, or the attack misses instead, as the creature recoils from your majesty.

Once you assume this majestic presence, you can't do so again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

Foundry Note

The Assume Majestic Presence activity includes an Active Effect for tracking your presence.

The Recoil Save activity includes the saving throw for the attacking creature.

Recoil Save.name: Recoil Save
Recoil Save.condition: a creature hits you with an attack roll for the first time on a turn

Uncanny Dodge.name: Esquiva Asombrosa
Uncanny Dodge.description:
When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you (round down).

Foundry Note

With your token selected you can either right click on the damage roll's chat card and select  Apply Half Damage or click the "1/2" button and then the  Apply button.

Uncanny Dodge.name: Uncanny Dodge
Uncanny Dodge.condition: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack roll

Uncanny Metabolism.name: Metabolismo Asombroso
Uncanny Metabolism.description:
When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended Focus Points. When you do so, roll your Martial Arts die, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to your Monk level plus the number rolled.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

Using this feature will restore all expended Focus Points and offers a Healing roll for restoring your Hit Points. It includes a single free use per Long Rest.

Undying Sentinel.name: Centinela Imperecedero
Undying Sentinel.description:
When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead, and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to three times your Paladin level. Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

Additionally, you can’t be aged magically, and you cease visibly aging.

heal.condition: When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points

Use Magic Device.name: Usar Objeto Mágico
Use Magic Device.description:
You’ve learned how to maximize use of magic items, granting you the following benefits.

Attunement. You can attune to up to four magic items at once.

Charges. Whenever you use a magic item property that expends charges, roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a roll of 6, you use the property without expending the charges.

Scrolls. You can use any Spell Scroll, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability for the spell. If the spell is a cantrip or a level 1 spell, you can cast it reliably. If the scroll contains a higher-level spell, you must first succeed on an [[/skill arc]] check (DC 10 plus the spell’s level). On a successful check, you cast the spell from the scroll. On a failed check, the scroll disintegrates.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect that automatically increases your attunement maximum.

When using an item property that expends charges roll the d6 and uncheck the consumption box to use it for free.

Attunement Bonus.name: Attunement Bonus
Attunement Bonus.description: The Use Magic Device feature allows you to attune to up to four magic items at once.

Versatile Trickster.name: Tramposo Versátil
Versatile Trickster.description: You gain the ability to distract targets with your Mage Hand. When you use the [[/item Cunning Strike activity="Trip"]]{Trip} option of your Cunning Strike on a creature, you can also use that option on another creature within 5 feet of the spectral hand.

Visions of Distant Realms.name: Visiones de Reinos Distantes
Visions of Distant Realms.description:
Prerequisite: Level 9+ Warlock

You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplArcaneEye0]{Arcane Eye} without expending a spell slot.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplArcaneEye0 inline]

Vitality of the Tree.name: Vitalidad del Árbol
Vitality of the Tree.description:
Your Rage taps into the life force of the World Tree. You gain the following benefits.

Vitality Surge. When you activate your Rage, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your Barbarian level.

Life-Giving Force. At the start of each of your turns while your Rage is active, you can choose another creature within 10 feet of yourself to gain Temporary Hit Points. To determine the number of Temporary Hit Points, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. If any of these Temporary Hit Points remain when your Rage ends, they vanish.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an activity for Vitality Surge and Life-Giving Force which can be used to roll the Temporary HP. It does not automatically remove Life-Giving Force's Temporary Hit Points when your Rage ends.

Life-Giving Force.name: Life-Giving Force
Life-Giving Force.condition: Start of each of your turns while your Rage is active

Vow of Enmity.name: Voto de Enemistad
Vow of Enmity.description:
When you take the Attack action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You have Advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

If the creature drops to 0 Hit Points before the vow ends, you can transfer the vow to a different creature within 30 feet of yourself (no action required).

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect for tracking the creature you have vowed against but it does not automate the Advantage.

utility.condition: When you take the Attack action

War Bond.name: Vínculo de Guerra
War Bond.description:
You learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between yourself and one weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a Short Rest. The weapon must be within your reach throughout the ritual, at the conclusion of which you touch the weapon and forge the bond. The bond fails if another Fighter is bonded to the weapon or if the weapon is a magic item to which someone else is attuned.

Once you have bonded a weapon to yourself, you can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you have the Incapacitated condition. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon that weapon as a Bonus Action, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

You can have up to two bonded weapons, but you can summon only one at a time with a Bonus Action. If you attempt to bond with a third weapon, you must break the bond with one of the other two.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an activity for summoning your weapon that can be used if you're tracking usage of your Bonus Action.

It also includes a Bond with Weapon activity which can be used to enchant your bonded weapons. It will append ", War Bonded" to its name for easy identification.

War Bond.name: War Bond
War Bond.description: Once you have bonded a weapon to yourself, you can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you have the Incapacitated condition. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon that weapon as a Bonus Action, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

War Domain.name: Dominio de la Guerra
War Domain.description:
Invoca el poder de la guerra

La guerra tiene muchas manifestaciones. Puede convertir a gente ordinaria en héroes. Puede ser desesperada y horrorosa, con actos de crueldad que eclipsan cualquier atisbo de gloria. Los clérigos de este dominio sobresalen en batalla.

War Domain Spells.title: Conjuros del Dominio de la Guerra

War Domain Spells.name: Conjuros del Dominio de la Guerra
War Domain Spells.description:
Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the War Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

War Domain Spells
Cleric LevelPrepared Spells
3@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicWeapo]{Magic Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShieldofFa]{Shield of Faith}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon}
5@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCrusadersM]{Crusader's Mantle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}
7@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireShield]{Fire Shield}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFreedomofM]{Freedom of Movement}
9@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldMonste]{Hold Monster}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSteelWindS]{Steel Wind Strike}

Foundry Note

These spells are granted automatically as you advance.

War God's Blessing.name: Bendición del Dios de la Guerra
War God's Blessing.description:
You can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShieldofFa]{Shield of Faith} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} rather than expending a spell slot. When you cast either spell in this way, the spell doesn't require Concentration. Instead the spell lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you cast that spell again, have the Incapacitated condition, or die.

Foundry Note

When casting the spell uncheck the "Consumption" checkbox and the "Concentration" checkbox.

War Magic.name: Magia de Guerra
War Magic.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with a casting of one of your Wizard cantrips that has a casting time of an action.

War Priest.name: Sacerdote de Guerra
War Priest.description: As a Bonus Action, you can make one attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike. You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once, currently [[lookup @abilities.wis.mod]]). You regain all expended uses when you finish a Short or Long Rest.

Warding Flare.name: Destello Protector
Warding Flare.description:
When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of yourself makes an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to impose Disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before it hits or misses.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once, currently [[lookup @abilities.wis.mod]]). You regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

The Flare activity includes a 30 foot emanation for identifying impacted creatures. It does not automate the Disadvantage.

Flare.name: Flare
Flare.condition: When a creature you can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll

Warlock.name: Brujo
Warlock.description:
Un Lanzador de Conjuros que Obtiene Poder Mágico de un Pacto con una Entidad

Atributos Básicos de Brujo

Característica Principal

Carisma

Dado de Puntos de Golpe

D8 por nivel de brujo

Competencias en Tiradas de Salvación

Sabiduría y Carisma

Competencias en Habilidades

Elige 2: Arcana, Engaño, Historia, Intimidación, Investigación, Naturaleza o Religión

Competencias con Armas

Armas sencillas

Entrenamiento con Armaduras

Armaduras ligeras

Equipo Inicial

Elige A o B: (A) @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Armadura de cuero}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepScimitar00]{Cimitarra}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Dagas}, símbolo arcano (orbe), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagScholarsPac]{Paquete de erudito}, y [[/award 19gp]]; o (B) [[/award 75GP]]

Los brujos buscan el conocimiento que yace oculto en el tejido del multiverso, forjando pactos con seres misteriosos para desbloquear efectos mágicos. Los brujos son impulsados por una búsqueda insaciable de conocimiento y poder.

La magia conferida a un brujo va desde pequeñas pero duraderas alteraciones hasta el acceso a potentes conjuros. A diferencia de estudiosos como los magos, los brujos complementan su magia con facilidad para el combate cuerpo a cuerpo.

Convertirse en Brujo …

Como Personaje de Nivel 1

  • Obtienes todos los atributos de la tabla \"Atributos básicos de brujo\".
  • Obtienes los rasgos de nivel 1 de brujo, que se muestran en la tabla \"Rasgos de brujo\".

Como Personaje Multiclase

  • Obtienes los siguientes atributos de la tabla \"Atributos básicos de brujo\": dado de puntos de golpe y entrenamiento con armaduras ligeras.
  • Obtienes los rasgos de nivel 1 de brujo, que se muestran en la tabla \"Rasgos de brujo\".
  • Consulta las normas de multiclase del capítulo 2 para determinar tus espacios de conjuro disponibles.

Max Pact Magic Spells.title: Conjuros Máximos de Magia del Pacto

Eldritch Invocations.title: Invocaciones Sobrenaturales
Eldritch Invocations.hint: You have unearthed Eldritch Invocations, pieces of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability or other lessons.

Contact Patron.title: Contactar Patrón
Contact Patron.hint: In the past, you usually contacted your patron through intermediaries. Now you can communicate directly; you always have the Contact Other Plane spell prepared.

Warping Implosion.name: Implosión Deformante
Warping Implosion.description:
You can unleash a space-warping anomaly. As a Magic action, you teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of yourself. Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d10 Force damage and is pulled straight toward the space you left, ending in an unoccupied space as close to your former space as possible. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points (no action required) to restore your use of it.

Warrior of Mercy.name: Guerrero de la Misericordia
Warrior of Mercy.description:
Manipula las fuerzas de la vida y la muerte

Los guerreros de la misericordia son monjes que aprenden a manipular la energía vital que fluye por todos los seres vivientes. Pueden usar esta energía para curar heridas y dañar a sus enemigos.

Warrior of Shadow.name: Guerrero de las Sombras
Warrior of Shadow.description:
Emplea las artes de la oscuridad y las sombras

Los guerreros de la sombra siguen una tradición monástica que aprovecha el poder de las sombras. Estos monjes se consideran un puente entre los mundos físico y espiritual, usando las sombras como medio de tránsito.

Warrior of the Elements.name: Guerrero de los Elementos
Warrior of the Elements.description:
Canaliza los cuatro elementos

Los guerreros de los elementos armonizan sus cuerpos con los elementos: tierra, fuego, agua y viento mientras canalizan su energía de monjes para realizar hazañas elementales sobrenaturales.

Warrior of the Gods.name: Guerrero de los Dioses
Warrior of the Gods.description:
A divine entity helps ensure you can continue the fight. You have a pool of four d12s that you can spend to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool, roll them, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll's total.

Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.

The pool's maximum number of dice increases by one when you reach Barbarian levels 6 (5 dice), 12 (6 dice), and 17 (7 dice).

Foundry Note

The pool size is automatically handled in this feature's scale value advancement.

Warrior of the Open Hand.name: Guerrero de la Mano Abierta
Warrior of the Open Hand.description:
Maestro de las técnicas de combate desarmado

Los guerreros de la mano abierta son maestros de las técnicas de combate desarmado. Aprenden técnicas para empujar y derribar a sus oponentes en combate y manipular el ki de sus adversarios.

Weapon Mastery.name: Maestría con Armas
Weapon Mastery.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

Whispers of the Grave.name: Susurros de la Tumba
Whispers of the Grave.description:
Prerequisite: Level 7+ Warlock

You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead} without expending a spell slot.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD inline]

Wholeness of Body.name: Plenitud del Cuerpo
Wholeness of Body.description:
You gain the ability to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can roll your Martial Arts die. You regain a number of Hit Points equal to the number rolled plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 Hit Point regained).

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Wild Companion.name: Compañero Salvaje
Wild Companion.description:
You can summon a nature spirit that assumes an animal form to aid you. As a Magic action, you can expend a spell slot or a use of Wild Shape to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFindFamili]{Find Familiar} spell without Material components.

When you cast the spell in this way, the familiar is Fey and disappears when you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

This feature includes a Summon activity which can be used to summon your wild companion. You can choose whether to expend a use of wild shape or a spell slot when activating it.

The summon does not automatically disappear when you finish a Long Rest.

Wild Magic Sorcery.name: Hechicería de Magia Salvaje
Wild Magic Sorcery.description:
La magia caótica fluye a través de ti

Tu magia innata proviene de las fuerzas salvajes delcaos que subyacen al orden de la creación. Podrías haber sido expuesto a magia cruda del Limbo o de otra manera marcado por la magia salvaje.

Wild Magic Surge.name: Oleada de Magia Salvaje
Wild Magic Surge.description:
Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Once per turn, you can roll 1d20 immediately after you cast a Sorcerer spell with a spell slot. If you roll a 20, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect.

If the magical effect is a spell, it is too wild to be affected by your Metamagic.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.tables.RollTable.phbWildMagicSurg rollable caption=false classes="wild-magic-surge"]

Wild Resurgence.name: Resurgimiento Salvaje
Wild Resurgence.description:
Once on each of your turns, if you have no uses of Wild Shape left, you can give yourself one use by expending a spell slot (no action required).

In addition, you can expend one use of Wild Shape (no action required) to give yourself a level 1 spell slot, but you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

The Regain Wild Shape activity consumes a spell slot and grants you another use of Wild Shape.

The Regain Spell Slot activity will consume a use of Wild Shape and grant you a level 1 spell slot.

Regain Spell Slot.name: Regain Spell Slot
Regain Spell Slot.condition: Once on each of your turns

Regain Wild Shape.name: Regain Wild Shape
Regain Wild Shape.condition: Once on each of your turns

Wild Shape.name: Forma Salvaje
Wild Shape.description:
The power of nature allows you to assume the form of an animal. As a Bonus Action, you shape-shift into a Beast form that you have learned for this feature (see “Known Forms” below). You stay in that form for a number of hours equal to half your Druid level (currently [[lookup @classes.druid.levels]]) or until you use Wild Shape again, have the Incapacitated condition, or die. You can also leave the form early as a Bonus Action.

Number of Uses. You can use Wild Shape twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

You gain additional uses when you reach certain Druid levels, as shown in the Wild Shape column of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDruid00000000.JournalEntryPage.UCOh3zlvGxyk5jLr#class-features]{Druid Features} table.

Current Number of Uses: [[lookup @scale.druid.wild-shape-uses]]

Known Forms. You know four Beast forms for this feature, chosen from among Beast stat blocks that have a maximum Challenge Rating of 1/4 and that lack a Fly Speed. The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobRat0000000]{Rat}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobRidingHors]{Riding Horse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobSpider0000]{Spider}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobWolf000000]{Wolf} are recommended. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace one of your known forms with another eligible form.

Wild Shape Automation

This feature includes a Transform activity. When you use it you can select the creature you'd like to Wild Shape into using the Compendium Browser. You can revert the transformation at the top of your sheet by clicking on the kebab menu (three vertical dots) and selecting Restore Transformation.

When you reach certain Druid levels, your number of known forms and the maximum Challenge Rating for those forms increases, as shown in the Beast Shapes table. In addition, starting at level 8, you can adopt a form that has a Fly Speed.

Current Known Forms Limit: [[lookup @scale.druid.known-forms]]

Current CR Limit: [[lookup @scale.druid.wild-shape]]

When choosing known forms, you may look in the Monster Manual or elsewhere for eligible Beasts if the Dungeon Master permits you to do so.

Beast Shapes
Druid LevelKnown FormsMax CRFly Speed
